intro: Hesperis microcalyx, commonly known as sweet rocket, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which range from white to pink, bloom in early summer and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
